<div id="readme" class="md" data-path="README.md"><article class="markdown-body entry-content container-lg" itemprop="text"><h1><a id="user-content-kineticjl" class="anchor" aria-hidden="true" href="#kineticjl"><svg class="octicon octicon-link" viewBox="0 0 16 16" version="1.1" width="16" height="16" aria-hidden="true"><path fill-rule="evenodd" d="M7.775 3.275a.75.75 0 001.06 1.06l1.25-1.25a2 2 0 112.83 2.83l-2.5 2.5a2 2 0 01-2.83 0 .75.75 0 00-1.06 1.06 3.5 3.5 0 004.95 0l2.5-2.5a3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95-4.95l-1.25 1.25zm-4.69 9.64a2 2 0 010-2.83l2.5-2.5a2 2 0 012.83 0 .75.75 0 001.06-1.06 3.5 3.5 0 00-4.95 0l-2.5 2.5a3.5 3.5 0 004.95 4.95l1.25-1.25a.75.75 0 00-1.06-1.06l-1.25 1.25a2 2 0 01-2.83 0z"></path></svg></a>Kinetic.jl</h1>
<p><a target="_blank" rel="noopener noreferrer" href="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d017eeec688a946f06dde43c1099a7c960215c41/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e636f6d2f76617672696e65732f4b696e657469632e6a6c2e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/d017eeec688a946f06dde43c1099a7c960215c41/68747470733a2f2f7472617669732d63692e636f6d2f76617672696e65732f4b696e657469632e6a6c2e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="" data-canonical-src="https://travis-ci.com/vavrines/Kinetic.jl.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a>
<a href="https://coveralls.io/github/vavrines/Kinetic.jl?branch=master" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent.com/04e7c248dac79e0acd596894c8730402f71629ed/68747470733a2f2f636f766572616c6c732e696f2f7265706f732f6769746875622f76617672696e65732f4b696e657469632e6a6c2f62616467652e7376673f6272616e63683d6d6173746572" alt="Coverage Status" data-canonical-src="https://coveralls.io/repos/github/vavrines/Kinetic.jl/badge.svg?branch=master" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>This Julia package serves as a tool box for theoretical and numerical studies towards the kinetic theory of gases, photons, plasmas and neutrons.
It can be used to solve either Boltzmann and related model equations</p>
<p><a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\frac{\partial&amp;space;f}{\partial&amp;space;t}+&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;u&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;x&amp;space;f&amp;space;+&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;a&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;u&amp;space;f&amp;space;=&amp;space;\int_{\mathcal&amp;space;R^3}&amp;space;\int_{\mathcal&amp;space;S^2}&amp;space;B&amp;space;(f(\mathbf&amp;space;u_*')f(\mathbf&amp;space;u')-f(\mathbf&amp;space;u_*)&amp;space;f(\mathbf&amp;space;u))&amp;space;d\Omega&amp;space;d\mathbf&amp;space;u_*" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="\frac{\partial f}{\partial t}+ \mathbf u \cdot \nabla_\mathbf x f + \mathbf a \cdot \nabla_\mathbf u f = \int_{\mathcal R^3} \int_{\mathcal S^2} B (f(\mathbf u_*')f(\mathbf u')-f(\mathbf u_*) f(\mathbf u)) d\Omega d\mathbf u_*" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\frac{\partial&amp;space;f}{\partial&amp;space;t}+&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;u&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;x&amp;space;f&amp;space;+&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;a&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;u&amp;space;f&amp;space;=&amp;space;\int_{\mathcal&amp;space;R^3}&amp;space;\int_{\mathcal&amp;space;S^2}&amp;space;B&amp;space;(f(\mathbf&amp;space;u_*')f(\mathbf&amp;space;u')-f(\mathbf&amp;space;u_*)&amp;space;f(\mathbf&amp;space;u))&amp;space;d\Omega&amp;space;d\mathbf&amp;space;u_*" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>or their upscaling moment system</p>
<p><a href="https://www.codecogs.com/eqnedit.php?latex=\frac{\partial&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;W}{\partial&amp;space;t}&amp;space;+&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;x&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;F&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;S" rel="nofollow"><img src="https://camo.githubusercontent." title="\frac{\partial \mathbf W}{\partial t} + \nabla_\mathbf x \cdot \mathbf F = \mathbf S" data-canonical-src="https://latex.codecogs.com/gif.latex?\frac{\partial&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;W}{\partial&amp;space;t}&amp;space;+&amp;space;\nabla_\mathbf&amp;space;x&amp;space;\cdot&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;F&amp;space;=&amp;space;\mathbf&amp;space;S" style="max-width:100%;"></a></p>
<p>The finite volume method (FVM) is employed in all cases.</p>
<p>The package is compatible with Julia 1.3 or newer version.
To make use of it, execute <code>Julia</code> and type</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>julia<span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> ]
(v1<span class="pl-c1">.3</span>) pkg<span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> add Kinetic</pre></div>
<p>This will install Kinetic and all its dependencies.
After that, load the package,</p>
<div class="highlight highlight-source-julia"><pre>julia<span class="pl-k">&gt;</span> <span class="pl-k">using</span> Kinetic</pre></div>
<p>That's it.</p>
</article></div>
